alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 1:20PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lauderdale County through 215 PM CST... At 120 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Savoy, or near Meridian, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Meridian around 125 PM CST. Zero around 130 PM CST. Marion around 140 PM CST. Toomsuba and Alamucha around 155 PM CST. Lauderdale and Kewanee around 205 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for east central Mississippi.
